@description.name: @description
@description.body: An abstract model for config files

@description.name: @description
@description.body: The base URL of all json schema definitions

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Name of the config file

@description.name: @description
@description.body: The path to the directory containing the config file Defaults to process.cwd()

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Schema version of the config file If string, validate all data against this version of the schema If null, do not validate

@description.name: @description
@description.body: The config data

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Flag to indicate that data has changed and needs to be saved

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Flag to indicate that data has been loaded

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Whether to throw an Error if validation fails (false, default), or to simply output a warning to the console (true)

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Whether to validate the model data (default: true)

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Whether to create the file if it doesn't exist yet (default: false) Setting this to true doesn't automatically create it, you still need to call save(). It just prevents an error during loading the config data. Only works if a "templateFunction" has been set.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: A function that returns the config file template which is used if no file exists and the "createIfNotExists" property is set to true

@description.name: @description
@description.body: The owning object

@description.name: @description
@description.body: {String} The ID of the object.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: The json-schema object

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Validates the given data against the schema that the model has been initialized with. Throws if not valid.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: The path to the configuration file

@description.name: @description
@description.body: The path to the configuration file, relative to CWD

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Returns the part of the schema URI that is identical for all paths

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Path to the schema json file in the file system

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Returns the URL of the JSON schema

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Returns the json-schema object

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Returns true if the config file exists, false if not

@description.name: @description
@description.body: This method can be used to get the config model singleton in a initialized state. It loads the config data into the model, unless data has already been loaded. If no argument is given, load from the file specified when the instance was created. If an json object is passed, use that data. In both cases, the data is validated against the schema that the model has been initialized with, unless it is missing schema information (for backwards-compatibility). Returns the instance for chaining. To reload the data, set the "loaded" property to false first.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Returns a value from the configuration map

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Sets a value from the configuration map and validates the result against the json schema of the model

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Unsets a property from the configuration map and validates the model

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Transforms a value at a given property path, using a function.

@param.name: @param
@param.description:
The transformation function, which receives the value of the property
    and returns the transformed value, which then is validated and saved.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Given a map containing property paths as keys and arbitrary values, return the map with values that are true if the property path exists and false otherwise.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Validates the stored config model data. Used when data is changed outside of the API. Will not validate if validate property is false.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Save the data to the config file

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Gets the (computed) value of the property qxOwner. For further details take a look at the property definition: {@link #qxOwner}.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Sets the user value of the property qxOwner. For further details take a look at the property definition: {@link #qxOwner}.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Resets the user value of the property qxOwner. The computed value falls back to the next available value e.g. appearance, init or inheritance value depending on the property configuration and value availability. For further details take a look at the property definition: {@link #qxOwner}.
